intro: Phacelia clinopodioides, commonly known as blue mountain phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Phacelia clinopodioides is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
